question: learning a foreign language at primary schools rather than secondary school. Do the adv intaantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
text: I would like to introduce Ms Mary Bell, who has been treated in our facility due to unstable (D)diabetes Mellitus and small infected left foot ulcer. She will be needing your medical and social assistance.

Ms Bell has been diagnosed with non-insullin-dependent diabetes (since)for 15 years. She was prescribed with hypoglycemic medications: Glimel, 5 mg daily and Metformin, 800 mg  thrice daily. However, she has occassional  issue with self-administration of hypoglycemic medications.

Notably she has small infected left foot ulcer, which was commenced with Augmentin Duo Forte. In addtional, daily saline dressing was done. Her ulcer was observed for any signs of infection, increase in wound margins and improvement in healing.
Subsequently, her alcohol intake increased and dietary intake decreased in quality after her retirement. She has no-known relatives her friends and reported no social interest.

It would be greatly appreciated if you could monitor the following: adherence to medications, blood sugar levels, alcohol intake, left foot wound improvement and dietary regime. Additionally, she has scheduled review after competion of her antibiotic. Kindly encourage her to participate in moderate excercise programme and social activities. It is recommended to involve  her in community social worker service.
